page.title: 02Farming in St. Ouen(1)
page.content: At the time of our survey count (June 1985) most of the fields in square 05545455 had new potatoes growing in them. Jersey Royal early potatoes are a popular crop in Jersey because the farmers can get a good price for them at the beginning of the season. This is because Jersey is further south than England and has a milder climate, therefore crops are ready for harvesting earlier than England. Green house grown Jersey Royal potatoes are dug from April onwards, but most of the outdoor crop is harvested from May until the end of July. Most of the potatoes are dug by a harvester. A harvester digs up the potatoes from the ground and then passes them along the conveyor belt and back onto the ground.
